title: The Munich Olympics and the Making of the Modern Germany: Politics, Society and Culture, 1965-1972
abstractText: Focusing on the 1972 Olympic Games in Munich, this project discusses broader changes in the political, social and cultural spheres of West Germany from the mid-1960s to the early 1970s. These include the gradual transition from right to left in German politics, the interaction of national, regional and local identities, the difficult relations between 'political generations' in the context of '1968', the changing impact of the legacy of the German past and the rise of pragmatism in German-German relations.
